eventInfo.summitTheme:
The Triennial Flagship Event -
Construction Innovation Expo 2025
eventInfo.location: Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre (HKCEC) – Hall 1 A-B
eventInfo.audiences: Government Department / Engineering Consultant / Contractor /Private Organisation / VC Investor / University / Public Interested on Smart City Application etc...

subjects.head: ABOUT THIS YEAR EVENT
subHeads: The world is entering an era of Artificial Intelligence (AI) so does our geospatial industry. The powerful computer graphic recognition capability of AI through its machine learning algorithms has great impacts to geospatial data post processing work; especially toward the operation of feature recognition or extraction as well as change detection from the raster imagery and point cloud datasets. At the same time, the rapidly evolving spatial data acquisition technology formed strong support to facilitate AI application for enterprise level of implementation; new 3D geospatial data acquisition approach has made constant data collection in city scale basis becomes highly effective; nowadays city big data can be generated timely and cost effectively to cater for large scale AI applications.

Being able to understand the core principle of operation between city big data and AI is the determining factors to the success of your project. The 3D geospatial data capturing methodology includes photogrammetry and LiDAR approaches, this is the best training data collection media to secure the accuracy of AI result; 3D geospatial post processing software can provide efficient workflow for the execution of annotation labelling of AI to cater for its machine learning process. Neglection of the importance of the role of geospatial technology usually led to the undermining of the AI performance. The collaboration of AI and city big data practice can evolve into the integrated conceptual term – GeoAI.

This year, we have invited speakers from Hong Kong, mainland China, Singapore, Europe and USA to share their latest GeoAI applications and insights; especially focus on the GeoAI related disciplines includes SLAM, 3D mesh modelling with AI intelligence, auto defect inspection and stereo/AR visualisation devices that are significant to the project performance of private corporates as well as government departments. The potential synergy effect between AI and city big data is limited by user’s imagination only; it will reform organisation in term of workflow, labour resources and deliverable outcomes. Why not come to experience such “game changing” practice with us in this event.

subjects.head: About Hong Kong 3D Geospatial Summit
subHeads: The Hong Kong 3D Geospatial Summit is a premier annual user conference that brings together local GIS professionals, geospatial users, and stakeholders in a collaborative gathering. This event aims to explore new insights and advanced geospatial technologies related to smart city applications, with expert speakers from around the world sharing their knowledge and solutions. Since 2014, we have been promoting 3D geospatial technologies for optimal local application in Hong Kong through this Summit. As an iconic annual event, it provides an opportunity to benchmark local geospatial applications against international expertise and experiences.

The mission of the Summit is to introduce globally leading geospatial technologies into local practices; most of the presentation topics will focus on international applications, with some references from Mainland China. The spirit of the Summit is to promote the benchmarking of global geospatial technologies against local industry needs, helping users to validate their digital strategies and find the best solutions for their projects. Additionally, the event aims to showcase highly matured technologies with proven international success, addressing local challenges in city design, planning, environmental conservation, engineering construction, IoT monitoring, and law enforcement.
We look forward to seeing you at the 2025 Hong Kong 3D Geospatial Summit, which will be held this year inside the venue of the Construction Innovation Expo (CIExpo 2025).

guestInfo: Mr. Shaun Koo is a seasoned technologist and entrepreneur, boasting over a decade of extensive involvement in the realms of software and hardware start-ups. His profound experience is accentuated by his role as a mentor with 500 Global, where he provides invaluable advice to high-growth start-ups specialising in diverse domains such as artificial intelligence, construction-tech, robotics, IoT, and analytics.Currently, Shaun holds the pivotal positions of Chief Executive Officer & Chief Technology Officer at H3 Zoom.ai. In this role, he is responsible for the overall digital strategic management, development, and go-to-market initiatives integral to the company’s growth efforts. Shaun’s responsibilities encompass overseeing the entire digital product roadmaps and spearheading end-to-end technology commercialisation and implementation initiatives on both domestic and international fronts.

Mr. Zheng Yong graduated from the Department of Aerial Surveying and Remote Sensing at Wuhan University, majoring in Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing. Previously worked at Beijing Surveying and Mapping Design and Research Institute, serving as the Chief Representative for Tianbao China, Leica China, and Ashtek China The current president of Beijing Huatai Tianyu Technology Co., Ltd., led by his team, has developed an unsupported positioning technology that perfectly integrates SLAM technology, INS technology, and aerial photography technology, deeply and perfectly solving the technical problem that INS technology cannot work for a long time in the absence of GNSS, and pioneering the application of SLAM technology in the field of measurement.

Mr. Zhou Beichen As the Overseas Business Director at Vastitude Technology, He lead the initiative to promote the innovative application of Radar Satellite technology across Southeast Asia, focusing on delivering solutions for building safety, water infrastructure security, and transportation monitoring.

He hold a Master's degree in Applied Geographical Information Science (GIS) from the University of Sheffield, UK. My previous role at the Aerospace Information Research Institute (AIR), Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS), provided me with profound experience in international cooperation and satellite remote sensing applications. He spearheaded the establishment of a collaborative network with several international space agencies, orchestrated high-level international forums, and played a key role in the global promotion and user training of the SDGSAT-1 satellite, making its data accessible to scientists in over 100 countries.</br>

Leveraging my coordinating experience in both optical and radar satellite domains, He is dedicated to understanding the satellite application needs across various global regions (including Pan-Asia Pacific, South America, the Middle East, and Africa) and translating cutting-edge remote sensing technology into practical solutions to address real-world challenges and contribute to global sustainable development.

Mr. Zhiqiang Yao is the founder and Managing Director of WUXI SMARTSEA TECHNOLOGY LTD since 2013 Oct. for the ROV & underwater inspection solution related products sales and service business in China market. He has a Bachelor's degree in Electronic Information Engineering from Northwestern Polytechnic University and a Master's degree in National University of Singapore. He was worked for CSSC from 2003 to 2008 and joined the member of IEEE OES in 2016. He was received the ROV technical service training certification of SAAB Seaeye and Teledyne SeaBotix.

Mr. Eric Yau is the Senior Geospatial Manager of AMBIT Geospatial Solution Ltd, he has over 23 years of geomatic engineering experience including GIS, Remote Sensing, LiDAR and Digital Photogrammetry. He obtained his BA (Hons) in Geography from the Hong Kong Baptist University; MSc in GIS from the University College London and MA in Transport Policy & Planning from the University of Hong Kong. Throughout his two decades of local geospatial practice, he has developed a track career records through participate as the GIS Specialist roles in the consultancy services for various Hong Kong government departments including CEDD, PlanD, GEO, LandsD, AFCD, DSD, WSD, TD, HKHS, HD, PD, FSD and CIC etc. He is one of the pioneers in use of new generation of 3D GIS for applications in Hong Kong. Since 2014 he has been participating in using new generation of 3D geospatial technology to support smart city development for the government. AMBIT is currently the prime high resolution 3D city data provider to various government departments; its accomplished project areas have covered 95% of urban area of Hong Kong in term of aerial photogrammetry and has accomplished the LiDAR airborne acquisition for the entire 1024km2 of Hong Kong territory for CEDD in 2020.

guests.guestTitle: 泰瑞歐洲研究院院長, 泰瑞數創科技（北京）有限公司首席科學家、博士
guestInfo: Mr. Huang Dong currently serves as Dean of the Terai Europe Research Institute. He earned his Ph.D. in Computer Science from Karlsruhe University of Technology, Germany in 2007, publishing over 10 papers (including 6 in English) and participating in numerous domestic and international academic conferences. He previously worked at DaimlerChrysler and Siemens Corporate Research in the field of communication security, focusing on information system integration and communication system development.His professional expertise encompasses digital twin platform and spatial intelligence application R&D and design, remote sensing surveying and GIS systems, as well as smart city systems. In 2017, he led the development of the SmartEarth Real-World Cloud Computing and Big Data Platform, which received the Second Prize in the National Geographic Information Science and Technology Progress Awards. He holds the Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) qualification and the Financial Risk Manager (FRM) certification from the Global Association of Risk Professionals (GARP).
guests.companyName: 泰瑞數創科技(北京)股份有限公司

guestInfo: Mr. Felix Puls Felix Puls is the Global Business Development Manager for Phase One Aerial Systems (PAS). He is responsible for expanding the PAS business with the latest complete airborne camera solutions, such as the ultra-large frame camera PAS PANA and the 2-in-1 large format and oblique sensor PAS 880i. Felix holds a Master degree in Geomatics from the Technical University of Munich, Germany. Working for more than 25 years as an International Sales and Business Development Manager in the earth observation industry, he has a wide variety of experience in photogrammetry and remote sensing from very high-resolution satellite imagery and products to high tech airborne imaging and LiDAR sensors.
guests.companyName: Phase One Asia Pacific Co. Ltd.

speechs.themeInfo: Experience the Cutting Edge Products & Meet the Presenters in the Booths

In the recent years, the promotion of use of digital technology is popular in Hong Kong; very often corporate users are given various technology solutions by vendors when encountering problem; it is difficult if not impossible for normal user to choose from all sorts of digital technologies ranging from AI, IoT, GIS or BIM etc..; all these are the most popular means of digital technology that exists commonly in smart government application. The key to success for implementing innovative technology in most of corporate or government projects are the vision to select the right technology as well as using the best vendors in the relevant discipline to carry out the work for you. In this assembly, we will benchmark similar application from the global perspective in order to provide insight to the audiences during decision making for innovative application.

speechs.theme: AI in the AEC (Architecture, Engineering & Construction) Industry
speechs.themeInfo:
H3Zoom is a highly success AI company in Asia region specialise in defect detection; developed for over 10 years by 4 million of imagery of training dataset, it forms such a national scale of success story in AI building defect detection. Nowadays at least 95% of public housing in Singapore is maintaining by H3Zoom’s AI application; its AI analysed report/results is even endorsed by the Singaporean national legal ordinance. Based on such success AI baseline model, it has been transforming its defect identification capability to drainage pipeline analysis for the PUB of the Singapore Government.
The presentation aims to delve deep into the integration and impact of AI in the construction and architecture sectors. With the rapid advancements in AI, processes that were once manual and time-consuming, such as construction inspections, are undergoing significant transformations. Shaun Koo, the Chief Executive Officer and Co-Founder of H3 Zoom.AI, will provide insights into the challenges, integrations, and future prospects of AI in these sectors. The discussion will also touch upon the regulatory and ethical considerations when deploying AI for infrastructure monitoring across different countries.

speechs.theme: 天地一體化實景三維解決方案
speechs.themeInfo:
天地一體，我們是指在無人機解決快速獲取空中實景三維的同時，我們可以通過MS-96快速、高效地獲取地面甚至室內、地下的實景三維數據。然後將MS-96獲取的地面數據與航空攝影獲得的數據通過傾斜攝影建模軟體進行融合，從而實現從天空到地面、室內甚至地下融為一體的三維實景數據。MS-96實景三維系統不僅是一款背負式的三維實景系統，它通過更換搭載平台可以成為車載、靜態三維激光掃描儀，其通過SLAM融合INS算法，採集數據效率最高速度可達60KM每小時。
此次報告中，我們不僅帶來了SLAM+INS+航空攝影融合算法與其他SLAM產品的優勢與區別，同時會以案例形式來分享我們再實際數據生產過程中的應用方向，如大型商超的室內導航應用、城市級道理數據獲取方式，在不同環境中一機多用的數據成果展示，具體包括：人民大會堂金色大廳成果展示、城市級道路地面傾斜數據生成方式、室內傾斜模型效果展示、上萬平米商超數據成果展示、交通樞紐數據成果展示、工廠生產線數據成果展示等。
speechs.themeInfo_byKaden: The conventional mobile mapping systems (MMS) face significant challenges when operating in Hong Kong's densely populated environment. The Viametris MS-96 stands out with its cutting-edge Slam algorithm, requiring minimal ground control points to achieve remarkably accurate results. This system excels in acquiring high-relative-accuracy LiDAR and top-notch imagery data, enabling the creation of superior-quality 3D city models. The MS-96 sensor is versatile, making it ideal for indoor or civil infrastructure 3D modeling, thus facilitating various applications such as Building Information Modeling (BIM), highways, tunnels, railway stations, and the preservation of historic or iconic structures.

speechs.themeInfo: Coffee Break, Booth Exhibition and Networking

speechs.theme: The Missing Link to An Effective Spatial Decision Supporting System
speechs.themeInfo: In the past ten years, due to the rapid development of oblique photogrammetry modelling technique and the BIM utilisation in digital twin application, it has made many corporate users started to develop departmental 3D viewing system for integrated management as well as dissemination of such high-resolution 3D spatial dataset. Various of naming has evolved for such 3D viewing system such as GeoBIM, DWSS, CDE, 3D online repository or digital twin visualisation system etc.. based on the will of the end users. For the purpose of enterprise application, the optimal technology to manipulate such massive amount of city scale spatial data is 3D GIS. The speaker will benchmark the latest 3D geospatial technology of the global industry; justify the critical components during selection of the 3D GIS; the shortage of existing common opensource 3D solution – Cesium and finally demonstrate the leading functionality of 3D GIS that is using in global regions including the London 3D smart city modelling and the special force operation at Middle East in Gaza.

speechs.theme: SKYLINEGLOBE 3D GIS APPLICATION IN EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AND CONSTRUCTION DIGITISATION (SKYLINEGLOBE 在應急管理與智慧工地的應用)
speechs.themeInfo:
基於Skyline平台，運用3DGIS+IOT技術，在應急管理方面：結合自然災害基本特徵，整合二三維地理空間數據、業務數據、多媒體數據，疊加動態/靜態應急數據信息，通過多源數據融合，建立內容豐富、位置準確、立體多維的三維可視化場景，並基於三維可視化場景，研發場景瀏覽、信息匯聚、災情信息分析、災情監控、輔助決策和應急指揮等功能，實現災害的態勢感知、災害趨勢推演、力量調度與部署、決策方案生成，全面提升應急部門災害救援效率，有效減少人員傷亡與財產損失。
在智慧工地方面：將工地管理過程中產生和收集到的數據，進行數字化、信息化的高密度融合，通過多源數據融合技術將工地進行高仿真還原，並將施工現場安裝的多種前端感知設備和信息采集設備所獲取的數據資源匯集到系統中與三維空間數據進行綁定，可視化展現出前端設備的空間位置信息，達到三維可視化展示工地施工的全過程，有效的做到了工地信息的精細化管理。
Coffee Break, Booth Exhibition and Networking

Hong Kong is a city with profound tradition for the fusion of oriental and western cultures; while adopting various international as well as mainland China’s technologies for innovative applications, it is important to realise the local constraints and challenges in smart city application; the best approach for implementing innovative technology is to allow local party to jointly develop the solution; such that it can facilitate project outcome through utilisation of local knowledge as well as maximise the benefit of technological innovation to the local society.
Final opportunity to visit the exhibition stands

speechs.theme: THE POINT CLOUD INTELLIGENCE FROM THE BEST LIDAR POINT CLOUD PROCESSING SYSTEM IN THE WORLD
speechs.themeInfo: TerraScan is a popular software application used for processing and analyzing point cloud data, particularly from airborne and terrestrial laser scanning systems (LiDAR). It is widely employed in various industries such as surveying, engineering, and infrastructure management. Automating point cloud processing tasks with TerraScan can greatly enhance efficiency and consistency in workflows. By leveraging TerraScan's automation capabilities through TerraScript, use can streamline and optimize point cloud processing workflows, saving time and effort while maintaining consistency and accuracy in results. In this seminar expert from TerraScan will use several usecases in Europe to demonstrate how to use automation and AI to effectively process pointcloud data.

speechs.theme: THE POINT CLOUD INTELLIGENCE FROM THE BEST LIDAR POINT CLOUD PROCESSING SYSTEM IN THE WORLD
speechs.themeInfo: TerraScan is a popular software application used for processing and analyzing point cloud data, particularly from airborne and terrestrial laser scanning systems (LiDAR). It is widely employed in various industries such as surveying, engineering, and infrastructure management. speechs.theme: Aerial surveying is an indispensable tool in modern geospatial analysis
speechs.themeInfo: Aerial surveying is an indispensable tool in modern geospatial analysis, environmental monitoring, urban planning, and various other fields. Asian Aerospace Services uses the Diamond Aircraft DA42MPP & DA62MPP, known for the most efficient aircraft in the industry, equipped with state-of-the-art remote sensing solutions from Riegl (Lidar Scanner) and IGI ( IMU, Digital Aerial Camera) to do Airborne Surveys in a wide range of applications in the Asia-Pacific Region. In this seminar,  Mr. Franz Malmer will delve into the intricacies of aerial surveying, exploring its experiences in using cutting edge aerial survey applications and methodologies in the Japan region, along with disscusing the diffculties and challenges of deploying aerial survey mission.

booths.boothTheme: Skyline HTML5 3D Web Platform - manned by Captain Sun
booths.boothInfo: The Skyline Globe Software System is one of the best 3D GIS system in the industry. Mr. Captain Sun from Skyline will demonstrate how to utilize the Skyline product series for 3D GIS analysis. Several 3D models will be displayed with Skyline TerraExplorer, which will present the data in a new level by simply clicking and scrolling, user experience an extremely detailed view of 3D Mesh Model of Hong Kong. In addition, methodology to create the extraordinary 3D models with Skyline Software Systems will also be presented. Live demonstrations including the latest integrated application with Microsoft Hololen2 AR visualization experiencing as well as the completely new version 8 of SkylineGlobe 3D GIS solution.

booths.boothTheme: Ambit Geospatial – manned by Denson Kong and Rik Kam
booths.boothInfo: The presenter of AMBIT will showcase its latest aerial surveying UAV – Mark X,  which is designed as the intermediate option of UAV in between the product line of DJI’s Mavic 3 and M300; which is light weight enough to be below 7 kg yet provides an hour of endurance of flight time as well as capable to mount industrial grade payload (3kg) of sensors to acquire highest quality of both photogrammetry and LiDAR data. Such US patented design is the best of its breed in the aerial surveying industry; and is the fourth generation of aerial surveying UAV that is design and manufactured by AMBIT since 2014 in Hong Kong. Custom developed handheld photogrammetric devices – Pano360 and Spatial – X, which is designed for close range photogrammetry 3D application as well as AI inputting data source will be demonstrated in the booth.

booths.boothTheme: ViAmetris Mobile Mapping Systems – manned by Zheng Yong
booths.boothInfo: The conventional mobile mapping systems (MMS) face significant challenges when operating in Hong Kong's densely populated environment. The Viametris MS-96 stands out with its cutting-edge Slam algorithm, requiring minimal ground control points to achieve remarkably accurate results. This system excels in acquiring high-relative-accuracy LiDAR and top-notch imagery data, enabling the creation of superior-quality 3D city models. The MS-96 sensor is versatile, making it ideal for indoor or civil infrastructure 3D modeling, thus facilitating various applications such as Building Information Modeling (BIM), highways, tunnels, railway stations, and the preservation of historic or iconic structures.
booths.boothInfo_Backup: Mr Zheng yong from WinTech will demonstrate a few ViAmetris newest city mobile mapping products, including ViAmetris iMS3D bMS3D vMS3D and the latest of VMMS 3D system MS-96 Mobile Scanning Technology For any their application in smart government and smart city. VIAMETRIS is the manufacturer of mobile mapping systems to address indoor/outdoor scanning challenges around the world. For 15 years, ViAmetris developed accurate, high quality and value-added solutions to improve acquisition processes and data management for Lidar based mapping, point cloud management in general, and integration of subsequent data collection. Viametris also has a range of post-processing software (PPIMMS) and automatic scan data recognition software (Vision MaGeLAAn) for civil engineering, land surveying, architecture, and BIM usecase.

booths.boothTheme: Automating and Digitizing Building Facade Inspections - manned by Shaun Koo
booths.boothInfo: Mr. Shaun Koo will present the H3 Zoom developed AI system that is capable of detecting over 30 building and facade defect types, including cracks, corrosion, paint peeling. In the demonstration, defects can be identified on surfaces such as concrete, cladding, glass, or metallic surfaces, which can improves safety by reducing work-at-height incidents through automated drone inspections that can reach elevated and hard to access areas, accelerate the building inspection process with lower cost.

booths.boothTheme: 一體化高精度實景三維技術 – manned by 周北辰
booths.boothInfo: 展台將分享由我們公司自研自采的高精度實景三維技術和成果，在深圳、北京、廣州等智慧城市方向的應用，以及在長城、敦煌莫高窟、雲崗石窟、武當山等文化遺產保護領域的應用。展品產品有雙魚系列、定拍DShot、MiniRTK、智影系列、鷹眼系列等等，配套展示的軟件有重建大師、雲端地球、重建農場、模方、DasViewer、網格大師等等。

booths.boothTheme: Immersive 3D Visualization - manned by Orlando Grimaldi
booths.boothInfo: 3D PluraView System provide the optimum stereo-viewing environment for a comfortable and fatigue-free work experience with all 3D-stereo applications. Our innovative and reliable PluraView beam-splitter technology is the basis for pixel-precise, stereoscopic 3D image displays, offering the highest stereo viewing quality possible. Currently, PluraView stereo displays can be configured with screen diagonals of up to 28”, resolutions up to 4K (UHD) and a color depth of 10-bit per pixel.

booths.boothTheme: PhaseOne Aerial Survey Camera Systems – manned by Felix Puls
booths.boothInfo: Introducing the world’s highest resolution sensor the PAS 880 , this is the PhaseOne flagship full frame ultra-high resolution aerial camera with 280MP nadia image and 150MP oblique image. The high-quality images can be used for in several application including aerial mapping, forensic study, cultural heritage conservation, inspection, forestry and agriculture. The PhaseOne system was deployed in several largest 3D City Mapping projects in the world, such as London 3D City model, Switzerland and Australia.
booths.boothInfo_Backup: Phase One has core imaging technologies and a range of digital cameras and imaging modules, setting new standards for image quality in terms of resolution, dynamic range, color fidelity and geometric accuracy.  Ms. Joanna Cheng from Phase One will present their precise aerial 2D and 3D mapping cameras and photogrammetry solutions at their booth. The solutions simplify aerial survey and mapping processes with a diverse and easy-to-integrate line of product.
